scientist.name: George Boole
scientist.description: Modern logic begins with Boole's seminal work "Mathematical Analysis of Logic". Boole's fundamental idea is using algebraic formulas to express logical relations.

scientist.name: Leibniz
scientist.description: Leibniz developed the notion of a logical calculus and formulated the principal properties of logical operators.

scientist.name: Aristotle
scientist.description: Aristotle was the first formal logician. He demonstrated the principles of reasoning and employed variables.

scientist.name: StartLogicIdea
scientist.description: The object of science is the knowledge of laws and relations - George Boole, An Investigation of the Laws of Thought
scientist.descriptionRu: Объектом науки, правильно так называемой, является знание законов и отношений - Джордж Буль, An Investigation of the Laws of Thought
